The Find Closest tool finds and ranks the features that are closest to specified locations.

The starting layer around which a search range will be drawn to find the closest features from the near layer. Features in the near layer will be returned based on their proximity to the input layer. Layers with up to five thousand features are supported.

The starting layer around which a search range will be drawn to find the closest features from the near layer. Features in the near layer will be returned based on their proximity to the input layer.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

The features found based on proximity to the input layer. Layers with up to five thousand features are supported.

The features found based on proximity to the input layer.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

One or more point features that act as temporary restrictions (barriers) when traveling on the underlying streets. Travel is permitted on the street but not through the barrier.

One or more line features that act as temporary restrictions (barriers) when traveling on the underlying streets. The line barriers prohibit travel anywhere the barriers intersect the streets.

One or more polygon features that act as temporary restrictions (barriers) when traveling on the underlying streets. The polygon barriers prohibit travel anywhere the polygons intersect the streets.

The method that will be used to measure distance or time. The method can be line distance or a travel mode.

The date and time that the traveler departs from the locations in the Input layer value.

Specifies whether a custom maximum number of closest features is used (enabled) or the tool default maximum of 100 is used.

The maximum number of closest features that can be found for each input feature.

Specifies whether a maximum search range is used (enabled) or the search range is unlimited.

The maximum search range for finding the closest features.

The units used to specify the search range.

The name of the layer that will be created and added to the map.

Specifies whether each result route will be saved as a route layer.

The name of the folder in My content where the results will be saved.
